align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="23081"comment_id="518242"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Tralala-23081.html?ccid=518242#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent512298" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc512298" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="rickyrebarco"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/268860"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.268860.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="rickyrebarco" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Five-O-Clock-Au-Gingembre-2764.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2764.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Five O'Clock Au Gingembre"title="Five O'Clock Au Gingembre"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma512298ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd512298" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/268860">rickyrebarco</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-08-10">08/10/14 12:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>First of all, I must say that I do not find this to be a gourmand.  There is a bit of a sweetish vanilla note in the final drydown, but for the most part, to my nose this is a bitter leathery, incensy and boozey fragrance.  The bitterness finally evens out in the drydown, but this is nothing I would ever want to wear.  For those who love well balanced boozey and leathery scents, this should be heaven.  Sillage and longevity are good.  I do not find it to be reminiscent of Shalimar at all.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="23081"comment_id="512298"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Tralala-23081.html?ccid=512298#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent511941" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc511941" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="rosecat"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/117046"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.117046.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="rosecat" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma511941ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd511941" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/117046">rosecat</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-08-09">08/09/14 03:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>What a fanciful perfume! Its la Sweet Carnivale, ..candy floss, marzipan, turkish delights and incense.  This is an unusual gourmand with monstrous silage, it grows and grows. This is not for the faint hearted! Do try if your seeking something super sweet and quirky. In the end it was much tooo much for me though I did enjoy the first half hour.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="23081"comment_id="511941"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Tralala-23081.html?ccid=511941#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent483387" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc483387" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Houdini4"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/607493"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.607493.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Houdini4" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-Indemodables/Vanille-Havane-Coeur-de-Oud-96892.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96892.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanille Havane Coeur de Oud"title="Vanille Havane Coeur de Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma483387ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd483387" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/607493">Houdini4</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-05-08">05/08/14 08:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Basically I can sum up Tralala in a few notes...<br />
Musk, vanilla, BOOZE, and saffron.<br />
I'll just mention the saffron it has an odd sharp quality and is pungent but I love it in fragrances. Although it's not a major player in this one, you can detect it and it adds to overall opulence.<br />
Quite a theatrical bright, rough, almost gourmand opening which is pretty spectacular in truth and the whisky element is present straight away. A whisky note is not something I like in many fragrances I'll be honest but here in Tralala it's somehow exceptable.<br />
As it calms the fragrance becomes quite smooth and vanilla like almost like a milky drink with alcohol in...a white russian prehaps? (But far dirtier of course!)<br />
 In fact I had a bourbon whiskey float cocktail a few weeks back and this reminded me heavily of the curdling combo of strong booze and ice cream which is not such a pleasant thing!  <br />
So as Tralala rages on my skin it starts to become cloying and there's only so much I can take of the musky vanilla which does get a bit much after a while. <br />
It's a little more complex than I'm giving it credit for and after you get past the cloying faze and it really dies down it goes nice again, even a bit soft and leathery.<br />
So all in all an interesting fragrance and great longevity one of the stronger Penhaligon's I've come across. <br />
Tralala is an acquired taste maybe but so is the creepy dolls head stopper on the bottle. I wasn't familiar with Meadham &amp; Kirchhoff's fashion house before but I get the picture with the style and this scent certainly ties in with the look of there clothes, bold and slightly eccentric!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="23081"comment_id="483387"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Tralala-23081.html?ccid=483387#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent481436" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc481436" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="originaldeftom"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/7036"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.7036.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="originaldeftom" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma481436ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd481436" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/7036">originaldeftom</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-05-01">05/01/14 17:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Love it!  Triggers so many childhood memories of various dolls and dolls theatres.  I grew up in Germany &amp; Austria where we had tons of creative outlets in form of dolls theatres.  The arguably most popular one was "Kasperle" with his crocodile friend.  <br />
<br />
This scent creation (courtesy of the ever-imaginative genius that is Msr Duchaufour) triggers all these early childhood memories for me.  It is an olfactory rollercoaster, a fairground, a carroussel of memories, experiences, songs and rhymes, seasoned with all things edible and memorable and gourmand: Toffee Apples, Crème brûlée with that crackling bittersweet almost burnt sugar topping, Hot Treacle over ice-cream, Toffee, and those chocolates on grandmother's Christmas tree filled with alcohol (=whiskey) that you were not supposed to have....but you had it anyways.<br />
<br />
It's almost as if the two protagonists (the Caspar and the Crocodile) represent the good=chocolate and the bad=alcohol, yet you like them both for one is sweet and the other one is dangerous and forbidden (so much for the psychoanalysis and early conditioning, but I digress).<br />
<br />
Love the boozy opening with the aldehydes and chocolatey, caramely, whiskey notes that jump right at you like a Caspar doll out of a gift box upon opening.<br />
Followed by some bittersweet violet, the tuberose gives it subtle, white floral sweetness, the saffron gives it spice and the carnation the bitter, pungent, nutty base.<br />
<br />
The musk comes like a slow rising fog and takes over, confusing the story (like a shift in plot) and throws it all around once more to create suspense....until we celebrate a happy ending with a smoldering and bittersweet, still boozy, warm vanilla.<br />
<br />
A round of applause, please!<br />
<br />
10/10 for story-telling.  8/10 for scent.  Great for fall/ winter.  Perfect gift for someone who works/ loves the theatre.  Gourmand, woody, musky oriental.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="23081"comment_id="481436"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Tralala-23081.html?ccid=481436#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent478413" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc478413" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Zerrax"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/706198"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.706198.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Zerrax" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Vetyverio-Eau-De-Parfum-46627.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46627.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vetyverio Eau De Parfum"title="Vetyverio Eau De Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma478413ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd478413" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/706198">Zerrax</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-04-22">04/22/14 00:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>finally i have it! Yesterday  I was at the Harvey Nichols in London were they presented this parfume.<br />
the smell is really nice and original, quit strong and it is long lasting, <br />
After 10 hours I on the plane back home I still could smell it.<br />
<br />
i don't had unisex parfumes in my collection yet, but this Tralala is going to change this, because this a unique parfume that smell's artistic, romantic and a little bit crazy, like a bonbon with a lot of alcohol inside ;-) <br />
you have to smell it for yourself, but for me this fragance was love at first sight!<br />
<br />
update: they told me at Penhaligon that at the end of this year they will release 4 new fragances! i can't hardly wait!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="23081"comment_id="478413"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Tralala-23081.html?ccid=478413#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent457836" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/33250">Mariame</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-01-29">01/29/14 02:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Something tells me that this looks like a new version of tabac blond.<br />
They have almost the same basic notes while leather and carnation are the main notes of the heart - in  tabac blond are on top.<br />
The  combination of aldehydes with violet on top seems that gives a vintage and powedery sensation.<br />
Weird though with the addition of whiskey note...<br />
The composition Intrigues me the most and i will seek for a sample when it is released.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="23081"comment_id="451324"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Tralala-23081.html?ccid=451324#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent448894" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; <br />
Love.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="23081"comment_id="1004024"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Tralala-23081.html?ccid=1004024#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent481436" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc481436" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="originaldeftom"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/7036"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.7036.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="originaldeftom" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma481436ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd481436" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/7036">originaldeftom</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-05-01">05/01/14 17:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Love it!  Triggers so many childhood memories of various dolls and dolls theatres.  I grew up in Germany &amp; Austria where we had tons of creative outlets in form of dolls theatres.  The arguably most popular one was "Kasperle" with his crocodile friend.  <br />
<br />
This scent creation (courtesy of the ever-imaginative genius that is Msr Duchaufour) triggers all these early childhood memories for me.  It is an olfactory rollercoaster, a fairground, a carroussel of memories, experiences, songs and rhymes, seasoned with all things edible and memorable and gourmand: Toffee Apples, Crème brûlée with that crackling bittersweet almost burnt sugar topping, Hot Treacle over ice-cream, Toffee, and those chocolates on grandmother's Christmas tree filled with alcohol (=whiskey) that you were not supposed to have....but you had it anyways.<br />
<br />
It's almost as if the two protagonists (the Caspar and the Crocodile) represent the good=chocolate and the bad=alcohol, yet you like them both for one is sweet and the other one is dangerous and forbidden (so much for the psychoanalysis and early conditioning, but I digress).<br />
<br />
Love the boozy opening with the aldehydes and chocolatey, caramely, whiskey notes that jump right at you like a Caspar doll out of a gift box upon opening.<br />
Followed by some bittersweet violet, the tuberose gives it subtle, white floral sweetness, the saffron gives it spice and the carnation the bitter, pungent, nutty base.<br />
<br />
The musk comes like a slow rising fog and takes over, confusing the story (like a shift in plot) and throws it all around once more to create suspense....until we celebrate a happy ending with a smoldering and bittersweet, still boozy, warm vanilla.<br />
<br />
A round of applause, please!<br />
<br />
10/10 for story-telling.  8/10 for scent.  Great for fall/ winter.  Perfect gift for someone who works/ loves the theatre.  Gourmand, woody, musky oriental.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="23081"comment_id="481436"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Tralala-23081.html?ccid=481436#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent522766" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc522766" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="daithi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/79487"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.79487.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="daithi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma522766ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd522766" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/79487">daithi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-09-14">09/14/14 06:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Penhaligon's offers an absolutely fascinanting scent. An appropiate way to describe "Tralala" would be "Guerlain meets Comme des Garçons". <br />
<br />
Its funny, playful, weird, excentric, romantic and mysterious. I can imagine Helena Bonham Carter wearing this. <br />
<br />
The scent is evocative of decadent pubs (the whiskey accord), vintage boudoirs (the powdery violet accord, a beautiful homage to Aprés l'Ondée and L'Heure Bleue according to the nose Bertrand Douchafour), Xmas celebrations (the marzipan-cherry main note) and mysterious chapels (the dark incense, leathery notes). <br />
<br />
Bravo Penhaligon's!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="23081"comment_id="522766"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Tralala-23081.html?ccid=522766#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent628260" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc628260" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mim"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/11492"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.11492.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mim" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Etat-Libre-d-Orange/Putain-des-Palaces-4521.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4521.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Putain des Palaces"title="Putain des Palaces"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma628260ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd628260" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/11492">Mim</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-09-08">09/08/15 20:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Words can hardly describe how beautiful this perfume is. It smells classic, artistic, weird, old fashioned, boozy, leathery, flowery and balmy, all at the same time. Vanilla is not very gourmet but more feminine and deep on my skin.    <br />
The balmy part of this fragrance reminds me of a Spikenard Perfume, but I also smell many crisp flowers, woody whiskey, dark incense, salty saffron, and fresh aldehydes here. It is vibrant and hard to compare. Also, sillage and longevity are great! 12+h on my skin!<br />
Now,  is the perfume inspired by the Tralala: The title character of an earlier Selby's short story from the novel "Last Exit to Brooklyn"?! We might never know. <br />
However, if you can ignore that controversy, this is one beautifully balanced and very well done fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="23081"comment_id="628260"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Tralala-23081.html?ccid=628260#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent751283" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc751283" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jyrhara"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/122251"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.122251.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jyrhara" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bottega-Verde/Magnolia-Nera-24513.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.24513.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Magnolia Nera"title="Magnolia Nera"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma751283ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd751283" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/122251">Jyrhara</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-10-12">10/12/16 03:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This perfume has been called crazy many times, but it is a kind of Tim Burton crazy, by which I mean fun and colourful. It's like the perfumer took some really serious notes and then just started playing with them. So you get boozy, and sweet, and powdery, and aldehydic, and leathery, all in the same fragrance, but there's a logic to this chaos. As for me, I'm enjoying my sample so much that I'm going to order a full bottle before they disappear completely.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="23081"comment_id="751283"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Tralala-23081.html?ccid=751283#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="23081" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">

padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1519052" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bel 1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1427354"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1427354.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="bel 1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Stephane-Humbert-Lucas-777/Sand-Dance-72384.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72384.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sand Dance"title="Sand Dance"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1519052ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1519052" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1427354">bel 1</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-03-08">03/08/22 10:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I took quite a gamble on this as I don’t typically like vanilla scents but love leather/incense/saffron/whiskey/violet and basically every other note listed. I get mostly a very powdery vanilla with a lot of whiskey and not much else, as unfortunately my nose never lets me smell anything other than vanilla when that note is present.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="23081"comment_id="1519052"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Tralala-23081.html?ccid=1519052#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="23081" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>

            <em>13DelanceySt</em> <img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/s.2190725.jpg"

    </div>
    <div class="latest-list flex-container">
        <img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/m.48100.jpg" style="width: 60px; height: 64px; margin-right: 0.5em; flex-shrink: 0"/>
        <a href="/perfume/Dior/Sauvage-Eau-de-Parfum-48100.html#cc2367170"><span class="link-span"></span>
            <span class="brand">Dior</span><br>            <span class="ztworowseclipse">Sauvage Eau de Parfum</span>

                <div id="popBrands" class="strike-title" style="margin-top: 4em;"><span>Most Popular Brands</span></div>
            <div class="grid-x grid-margin-y grid-margin-x text-center">
        <div class="cell small-4 medium-2 flex-container flex-dir-column">
        <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">1.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Lattafa-Perfumes.html" class="en2inter">Lattafa Perfumes</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">2.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Dior.html" class="en2inter">Dior</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">3.&nbsp;</span>

        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">50.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Afnan.html" class="en2inter">Afnan</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            </div>

    <script>

<script>
    var lang = 'EN';
    $(document).ready(function () {
                if (lang == 'EN') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.com") });
                if (lang == 'DE') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.de").replace(/designers/, "Designer").replace(/perfume/, "Parfum") });
                if (lang == 'ES') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.es").replace(/designers/, "disenador") });
                if (lang == 'FR') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.fr").replace(/designers/, "designer").replace(/perfume/, "parfum") });
                if (lang == 'CS') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.cz").replace(/designers/, "designer") });
                if (lang == 'IT') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.it").replace(/designers/, "designer") });
                if (lang == 'RU') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.ru") });
                if (lang == 'PL') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.pl").replace(/designers/, "marki").replace(/perfume/, "perfumy") });
                if (lang == 'PT') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.com.br").replace(/designers/, "desenhista") });
                if (lang == 'EL') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.gr").replace(/designers/, "designer") });
                if (lang == 'ZH') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.asia").replace(/designers/, "designer") });
                if (lang == 'NL') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.nl").replace(/designers/, "ontwerper").replace(/perfume/, "parfum") });
                if (lang == 'SR') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.punmiris.com").replace(/designers/, "dizajner").replace(/perfume/, "parfem") });
                if (lang == 'RO') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.ro").replace(/designers/, "creatori").replace(/perfume/, "parfum") });
                if (lang == 'AR') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragranticarabia.com").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
                if (lang == 'UK') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.ua").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
                if (lang == 'MN') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.mn").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
                if (lang == 'HE') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.co.il").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
            });
</script>


<script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFFe5cbbe5e5f689826b719ace22a5b2a11');
        });
    }
</script>
<script>
    $(document).ready(function () {
        $('#fragranticaloader').fadeOut(20);
    });
</script>
</body>
</html>
